thread.title: O’Reilly: ‘I’m Not Sure All These TV Appearances Are Helping the Trump Administration’
thread.title_full: O’Reilly: ‘I’m Not Sure All These TV Appearances Are Helping the Trump Administration’

author: Josh Feldman
title: O’Reilly: ‘I’m Not Sure All These TV Appearances Are Helping the Trump Administration’

organizations.name: these tv appearances are helping the trump administration

text:
O’Reilly: ‘I’m Not Sure All These TV Appearances Are Helping the Trump Administration’ by Josh Feldman | 9:20   
After criticizing the White House for not having better staff coordination and message discipline , Bill O’Reilly also argued tonight, “I’m not sure all these TV appearances are helping the Trump administration.” 
He highlighted how Kellyanne Conway was grilled by Matt Lauer this morning, saying there’s a chance of being attacked on every show (jokingly adding “except Fox & Friends , they’ll like you a little bit”). 
Bernard McGuirk gave her credit for “kicking butt” in a lot of her TV appearances, while Greg Gutfeld said that for someone raising four children, “dealing with the press is the easiest part of her day.” 
O’Reilly said the Trump administration doesn’t fully understand that everything they say can and will be used against them, bringing up that weird SNL Conway- Jake Tapper Fatal Attraction parody . 
Watch above, via Fox News. 
[ image via screengrab ]
